commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: support VPN instance and attachment descriptions

New 'instance_description' and attachment 'description' fields
can be defined via bagpipe-bgp API. They are then exposed to
provide helpful hints in the API.

Change-Id: I5c5b5abb60e2f2a817d180a0486e77c158f269bc

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

remove also tox-linters job, it cannot work since no linters environment
exists.

Change-Id: I259ce9991e748f3661e7a828c1fc1f6485404cc6

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.  Beginning
with Queens, we've adopted the convention that all specs stay in the
'approved' directory, and implemented specs are indicated by a
symlink in the 'implemented' directory.  This will prevent breaking
any URLs that refer to the approved specs.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-08 04:47:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/07048459ee14e11c1655eb92688938318557a113', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

requests that refer to the spec under the 'approved' path to the
new location of the file.

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-11-27 14:27:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/8916dc7ec728e10fe067e5ae039ebdc2d2a955e7', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-12-02 18:41:13.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/index.rst', 'specs/queens/implemented/index.rst', 'specs/queens/implemented/glance/deprecate-registry.rst', 'doc/test/redirect-tests.txt', 'doc/source/_extra/.htaccess'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/fe26e476f7ff8791bedf608e39594459f13d3e70', 'message': "Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

"}]
commit_message:
Move implemented spec to 'implemented'

Update the specs repo to indicate the Q-1 implementations.
This includes moving the spec, adding a redirect so the old
URL doesn't break, and adding a 'whereto' test.

Change-Id: I8aac14f306f35d14ca06ca742f556ef8afb866fe

subject: Fix upgrade test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 14:53:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/ca85dcc1da984905bb3a68299de5dcebb47943d2', 'message': "Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I681d5177c3d62d4cd44371fef0032fa8a0727dfd

commit_message:
Add dsvm job

Add a single node dsvm job with neutron segments enabled on
the ironic-provisioning network.

networking_baremetal mech driver and ironic-neutron-agent
enabled.

Related-Bug: #1658964
Depends-On: I041761dd896c9d89dc6cf7bafc991a0697ded05b
Change-Id: Ib4d93937c3985e51e2c10ded26af96d47b747f00

subject: Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-02 11:56:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/51d70af91d120c3f487cd72aef40d41aac76069e', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. In theory it's supposed to force a new
virtualenv to fetch the packages from upstream, but by using
this method, virtualenv can sometimes break when building a
new venv.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-02 11:59:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/1756989d8eaa984082a516a23e0b7f6a09c4830a', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. In theory it's supposed to force a new
virtualenv to fetch the packages from upstream, but by using
this method, virtualenv can sometimes break when building a
new venv.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-02 12:12:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/184182e65088f82a216f6beb7fb0f2936b9150df', 'message': "Properly ensure we use the right packages for each venv

The current method of simply removing the virtualenv_support
folder is a hack. It breaks virtualenv's ability to work
normally. In upgrades to Queens this is a problem as the
repo-server role sets up a virtualenv and needs it to work
normally.

This patch implements a better method which achieves the same
goal, but does it using the tooling provided rather than the
previous hack.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-02 12:25:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/46e09b9f6c6475f73727f811fab920e95c13e0de', 'message': 'Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

Closes-Bug: #1746935
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare virtualenvs without breaking the virtualenv tooling

When preparing virtualenvs, we have an implementation which
tries to ensure that the versions of pip, setuptools and
wheel are the ones we want them to be. In order to do that
we have previously removed the virtualenv_support folder
which contains the pip/setuptools/wheel versions that
virtualenv shipped with. This was done to prevent any
leaking of the wrong version into the virtualenv and was
the only way of doing it with much earlier versions of
virtualenv.

We can now update the method of achieving the same goal
without breaking the virtualenv tooling, which this patch
does.

The virtualenv_support folder missing is causing the
repo-server role which uses virtualenv to fail in upgrades
to queens. That role needs a complete and properly working
version of virtualenv in place.

Change-Id: I2c50bb693dc5dc505bddce34ff45294ac44f7dc9
Closes-Bug: #1746935

creating port groups.

subject: libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-29 18:29:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c76911b41bb82c80963dd3b3d1511d1ce9cece6f', 'message': "WIP libvirt: Use QEMU's native LUKS support

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS raw files and block devices to be
decrypted natively by QEMU. This change enables the use of this feature
within Nova when the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are
installed.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-14 14:20:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/648a2f3c68f77cad86ca226662ab70ee5bc2cba7', 'message': "WIP libvirt: Use QEMU's native LUKS support

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS raw files and block devices to be
decrypted natively by QEMU. This change enables the use of this feature
within Nova when the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are
installed.

TODO
  - Unit and functional tests
  - CONF option documentation
  - Upgrade tests to ensure encryptors can still detach

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-14 14:24:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5708476f19e04cf5788b15dc26e50728f6171278', 'message': "WIP libvirt: Use QEMU's native LUKS support

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-12-20 09:36:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a835a01cc9c4436eb562d7b0327d0c06a341707f', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within the Libvirt virt driver of
Nova when both the `volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled and
the appropriate versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed.

As with the original os-brick encryptors, encrypted volumes that do not
already contain a valid LUKS header will be formatted before use. The
original os-brick LuksEncryptor class is used to format volumes that
present a local block device on the compute host.

As rbd volumes were not supported by these encryptors a separate
codepath is used to format these volumes using qemu-img. At present this
requires that the original volume is removed before being recreated by
qemu-img. Future work should look to avoid the need to recreate the
volume by using QEMU >= 2.10 to convert the image in-place and also
using c-vol to preform this task for all volume backends.

If an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret associated with
it an attempt will still be made to detach LuksEncryptor from the volume.
This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior to this change
will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during detach or cleanup.

TODO
- Tests
- barbican-tempest-plugin
- swap_volume (?!)
- LM

Depends-On: I404070e2428cdf404b576d1d9da5b917f9be11d1
Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

If an encrypted volume does not have a Libvirt secret associated with

This will ensure any encrypted volumes connected prior to this change
will still detach the LuksEncryptor correctly during detach or cleanup.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2018-01-15 17:12:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d8a455c72c0cce273a11752b926f0fbb5d7b648f', 'message': "libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the
`volume_use_native_luks` configurable is enabled, appropriate versions
of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider for the
volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created during
_connect_volume to hold the passphrase used to unlock the encrypted
volume. The presences of this Libvirt secret is then used later to
generate the required encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret is present, allowing
encrypted volumes attached prior to this change to still be detached
correctly.

Finally, attempts to swap between volumes using native QEMU decryption
will be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do
not provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring
additional implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within
Nova.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2018-01-16 11:36:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/452ba083836fb973e751996870a427e7ec3529ba', 'message': "libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2018-01-17 10:28:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cdd0ae0fe2a6107a62a904624dd61f10879ea45e', 'message': "WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presences of this Libvirt
secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required
encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

WIP
---

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to help with live migration with encrypted volumes attached.

For Pike to Queens migrations the was_native_luks_available attribute
is added to the LibvirtLiveMigrateData object. This is used to
identify if the source compute was capable of configuring native
LUKS decryption. When Pike is the source host this attribute will be
missing leading to the Queens destination host falling back to the
os-brick encryptors when connecting to the volume during
pre_live_migration.

For Queens to Queens migrations was_native_luks_available will be set to
True assuming the correct QEMU and Libvirt versions are installed on the
source host. The destination will then connect to the encrypted volumes
using the native LUKS approach, creating a Libvirt volume secret. The
UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object for the volume and used on the source
while updating the domains XML before starting the migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2018-01-17 15:27:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a223faf35bff25ab47ea0b788342228dc9f55f5b', 'message': "WIP libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presences of this Libvirt
secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required
encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to support the following matrix of live migration (LM) scenarios:

- Pike using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using native QEMU decrypt
- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

A new 'src_supports_native_luks' attribute has been added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken,
creating a secret on the destination host. The UUID of this secret is
then stored in the individual LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object
associated with the volume and passed back to the source host to be
added to the volume configuration prior to the start of the live
migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:47:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d6ee94e6aedbd7905039989ebad8b103123370b5', 'message': "libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for encrypted volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presences of this Libvirt
secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required
encryption XML for the disk.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manor as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still requiring additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to support the following matrix of live migration (LM) scenarios:

- Pike using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using native QEMU decrypt
- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

A new 'src_supports_native_luks' attribute has been added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken only
if the destination host also supports native LUKS decryption by QEMU.

The UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object associated with the volume and passed
back to the source host to be added to the volume configuration prior to
the start of the live migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

for the volume is of type 'luks'.

secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required

write to the encrypted disk, removing the need for the os-brick supplied

in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from

- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken only
if the destination host also supports native LUKS decryption by QEMU.

The UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object associated with the volume and passed
back to the source host to be added to the volume configuration prior to
the start of the live migration.

commit_message:
libvirt: QEMU native LUKS decryption for encrypted volumes

QEMU 2.6 and Libvirt 2.2.0 allow LUKS encrypted RAW files, block devices
and network devices (such as rbd) to be decrypted natively by QEMU. This
change enables the use of this feature within Nova when the appropriate
versions of QEMU and Libvirt are installed and the encryption provider
for the volume is of type 'luks'.

When these conditions are met a Libvirt secret is created when
connecting encrypted volumes to a compute host to hold the LUKS
passphrase used to unlock the volume. The presence of this Libvirt
secret is then used by the volume driver to generate the required
encryption XML for the disk. QEMU is then able to natively read from and
write to the encrypted disk, removing the need for the os-brick supplied
dm-crypt style encryptors, previously used to handle encrypted volumes.

When disconnecting a volume the presence of a Libvirt secret will result
in no attempt being made to detach an os-brick provided encryptor from
the volume. This will only occur when no secret for the volume is found
on the compute host. This will allow encrypted volumes attached prior to
this change to still be detached correctly.

Attempts to swap between volumes while using native QEMU decryption will
be blocked in the same manner as they are when using volumes that do not
provide a local block device. Both use cases still require additional
implementation work in Libvirt before being allowed within Nova.

LibvirtLiveMigrateData and LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo are both extended
to support the following matrix of live migration (LM) scenarios:

- Pike using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using os-brick encryptors
- Queens using os-brick encryptors to Queens using native QEMU decrypt
- Queens using native QEMU decrypt to Queens using native QEMU decrypt

A new 'src_supports_native_luks' attribute has been added to
LibvirtLiveMigrateData in Queens to indicate that the source host is
capable of configuring QEMU LUKS decryption for a volume during LM.

The presence of this attribute in migrate_data during pre_live_migration
on the destination is then used to decide how encrypted volumes are
connected on that host ahead of LM starting.

When missing or False the os-brick encryptors will be attached, when
present and True the native QEMU decryption approach will be taken only
if the destination host also supports native LUKS decryption by QEMU.

The UUID of this secret is then stored in the individual
LibvirtLiveMigrateBDMInfo object associated with the volume and passed
back to the source host to be added to the volume configuration prior to
the start of the live migration.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks
Change-Id: Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

added_lines: @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "has_min_version") def test_use_native_luks(self, mock_has_min_version): """Assert that native LUKS is only used when the required versions are installed and a valid LUKS provider is present within the encryption metadata dict. """ drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) # True only when the required QEMU and Libvirt versions are avialable # on the host and a valid LUKS provider is present within the # encryption metadata dict. mock_has_min_version.return_value = True self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({})) self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'nova.volume.encryptors.cryptsetup.CryptSetupEncryptor' })) self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'CryptSetupEncryptor'})) self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'plain'})) self.assertTrue(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'nova.volume.encryptors.cryptsetup.LuksEncryptor'})) self.assertTrue(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'LuksEncryptor'})) self.assertTrue(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'luks'})) # Always False when the required QEMU and Libvirt versions are not # avilable on the host. mock_has_min_version.return_value = False self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'nova.volume.encryptors.cryptsetup.LuksEncryptor'})) self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'LuksEncryptor'})) self.assertFalse(drvr._use_native_luks({ 'provider': 'luks'})) def test_get_native_luks_volume_config(self, mock_keymgr, mock_host): pass def test_get_native_luks_volume_config_format_unencrypted_volume(self): pass def test_get_native_luks_volume_config_delete_secret_on_failure(self): pass

commit_message:
Use single quotes in deploy-steps.j2

Use single quotes instead of double quotes in values of key/value pairs
in Ansible tasks in deploy-steps.j2. The use of double quotes can cause
escaping issues later when Ansible is actually run.

Change-Id: I2f652cc9e40e23346fc212f0eb89a2f6b4a29023
Closes-Bug: #1744950
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/49/536849/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Single quotes are now used in the actual values of key/value pairs in deploy-steps.j2 for Ansible tasks. The use of double quotes can cause escaping issues later when Ansible is actually run.

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: improve update of export RTs

The current behavior, on an update of export RTs
was to re-originated all recevied routes with the new
export RTs, includings for re-advertised routes for which
the export RTs are not the RTs that should be used
(it should be readvertise/to_rts).  This problem was not
exposed in the use made of readvertisements by BGPVPN
and SFC drivers.

Another issue is that there was a concurrency issue
between VPNInstance reading the list of received routes,
and RouteTableManager populating this list, resulting
in rare occurences of such a traceback:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/api/controllers.py", line 210, in process
    self.manager.plug_vif_to_vpn(**attach_params)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/common/log_decorator.py", line 40, in wrapper
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/vpn/manager.py", line 338, in plug_vif_to_vpn
    vpn_instance.update_route_targets(import_rts, export_rts)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/common/log_decorator.py", line 40, in wrapper
    return method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/new/networking-bagpipe/networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/vpn/vpn_instance.py", line 458, in update_route_targets
    for route_entry in self.get_route_entries():
Set changed size during iteration

Change-Id: Ie55b29f4620c99e9ba3ba1c402ed0f7cf1cc9e98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/71/539871/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for route_entry in self.endpoint_2_route.values(): if new_export_rts: self.log.info("Re-advertising route %s with updated RTs " "(%s)", route_entry.nlri, new_export_rts) updated_route_entry = engine.RouteEntry( route_entry.nlri, None, copy.copy(route_entry.attributes)) # reset the route_targets, overwriting RTs originally # present in route_entry.attributes updated_route_entry.set_route_targets(self.export_rts) self.log.debug(" updated route: %s", updated_route_entry) self._advertise_route(updated_route_entry) else: self._withdraw_route(route_entry)

commit_message:
Use tasks for rhel registration

RHEL registration was implemented using the ExtraConfig interface.
However, this overrides an operator integration point. This can lead to
confusion when using the RHEL registration environment and also trying
to use ExtraConfig for some other configuration. In which case, the last
specified mapping would win, but with no clear indiciation of why the
other was not applied.

Use a custom Task, which by convention, are reserved for internal
TripleO usage for RHEL registration instead of the ExtraConfig
interface.

Change-Id: Idb5189337782583dd8075eeceea4dfa89ad33657
Closes-Bug: 1709441

deleted_lines: # applying to all nodes, e.g node registration/unregistration NodeExtraConfig: depends_on: [ControllerExtraConfigPre, NodeTLSData]

commit_message:
If virtualenv is broken, force re-install it

The virtualenv_support folder missing from the repo
container when upgrading due to the implementation
in the repo_build role which removes it. In order
to prevent breaking the virtualenv tooling, [1] is
being submitted. However, we still need to handle
the situation where the upgrade is done from a
version before that patch is implemented.

This patch implements a force-reinstallation of
virtualenv if the folder is missing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/540351

Change-Id: I2dcfa1abb46ee4e088dac7c9e77e9772ba8a269e
Closes-Bug: #1746935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/65/540365/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(odyssey4me): # The following two tasks only applies to Pike->Queens upgrades, # so they can be removed in Rocky. See: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1746935 - name: Check the status of the virtualenv_support folder stat: path: "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/virtualenv_support" get_attributes: no get_checksum: no get_md5: no get_mime: no register: _virtualenv_support # TODO(odyssey4me): # We force a reinstall of the required pip packages when the # virtualenv_support folder is absent. This is to ensure that # we're able to create the venv properly for pypiserver. # The state ternary filter can be removed in Rocky as this is # only required for Pike->Queens upgrades. state: "{{ (virtualenv_support.stat.exists | bool) | ternary(repo_server_pip_package_state, 'forcereinstall') }}"

commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: I7bc93fed29568adfc14d5bcadfc8728d3b5cf633
Closes-Bug: #1741051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/28/530928/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def require_policies(view_func, panel): """ Perform panel policy rule check to access the view. :param panel containing the view. Raises a :exc:`~horizon.exceptions.NotAuthorized` exception if the user doesn't match policy rules of the panel containing the view. """ from horizon.exceptions import NotAuthorized @functools.wraps(view_func, assigned=available_attrs(view_func)) def dec(request, *args, **kwargs): if not panel.can_access({'request': request}): raise NotAuthorized(_("You are not authorized to access %s") % request.path) return view_func(request, *args, **kwargs) return dec

commit_message:
Add api-ref and ironic state documentation for rescue

This patch adds following:
  - Updates ironic state documentation with rescue related states
  - Updates api-ref with rescue interface fields introduced in
    API version 1.38

Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aparna <aparnavtce@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>

Partial-Bug: 1526449

Change-Id: Ifcfa52ede62894b1990aaa640944be3431ddfe8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/419606/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _rescue: =========== Rescue Mode =========== Overview ======== Ironic now supports putting nodes in rescue mode for nodes using drivers that support it. As of the time of this writing, all drivers utilizing ironic-python-agent with the PXE boot interface can support rescue mode when configured appropriately. Rescue mode can be used to boot nodes into a ramdisk so that users can access the node for if something goes wrong that prevents normal access. For example, if there's a hardware failure preventing writes to a boot disk, rescue mode can be used to diagnose the problem. Configuring a rescue ramdisk ============================ .. TODO(mariojv) Outline this process here or link to IPA documentation when .. work on the rescue extension is complete. Maybe also include basic steps for .. putting it in glance Configuring ironic ================== .. TODO(mariojv) Validate that all this is correct & works in devstack After building a rescue ramdisk, you must configure ironic appropriately so that the service has the information needed to boot the ramdisk when a user tries to initiate rescue mode. This will differ somewhat between different deploy environments, but below outlines some example steps for how to do this: #. Configure a network to use for booting nodes onto the rescue ramdisk in neutron, and note the UUID of this network. This is required if you're using the neutron DHCP provider and have ironic managing ramdisk booting (the default). This can be the same network as your cleaning or tenant network. For an example of how to configure new networks with ironic, see the `relevant information in the install guide <http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/draft/configure-integration.html#configure-networking>`_. #. Add the UUID of your rescue network to ironic.conf:: [agent] ... rescue_network=YOUR_RESCUE_NET_UUID #. Each node usable with rescue mode will have to have the driver_info/rescue_kernel and driver_info/rescue_ramdisk attributes set to pass validation when the rescue command is issued. These should be the UUIDs of the rescue kernel and ramdisk you added to glance above:: ironic node-update NODE_UUID_OR_NAME add driver_info/rescue_ramdisk GLANCE_RAMDISK_UUID ironic node-update NODE_UUID_OR_NAME add driver_info/rescue_kernel GLANCE_KERNEL_UUID .. TODO(mariojv): You should probably update rescue validate() so this is not strictly required for rescue, in case someone's running their own dhcp unmanaged by ironic. Can fail rescue validate iff manage_agent_boot is True, instead .. TODO(mariojv) Link to appropriate api-ref docs for how to instantiate rescue .. on a node. Note that there has to be an instance booted on the node, and .. maybe have info on how to use this in standalone (just need configdrive + .. rescue_password)

subject: Add monasca-transform
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-02 13:06:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/monasca-transform/monasca-transform.README.config', 'openstack/monasca-transform/monasca-transform.spec.j2', 'openstack/monasca-transform/openstack-monasca-transform.service'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging/commit/f623204680e70dbb8866b5af86172c18a334da3c', 'message': "Add monasca-transform

Include monasca-transform, the aggregation engine for Monasca.
Also requires Apache Spark to be installed separately.

Specifying a Requires: spark == 1.6.3 seems desirable, but there
is currently no package widely available in the community for
installing that version, so the Requires: is left out to allow an
administrator to manually install from the .tgz or find a suitable
package.
To function properly, Monasca Transform requires a number of Spark
libraries (in .jar format) on the local system.  This install will
not change the versions of these .jar files listed in
/etc/monasca-tranform.conf, so an administrator should reference
the .conf file for names and versions to update.
Note that among those .jar files needed is a JDBC driver for connecting
to a MySQL-compatible database instance.  Drizzle-jdbc 1.3 is expected
and configured in monasca-transform.conf.

Different from other deployments, this .spec inserts an
entry_point into the setup.cfg to allow pbr to create a script,
then installs a .service file that points to the resulting
/usr/bin/monasca-transform script.

Note that the name of the monasca_transform directory in the
.tgz includes an _ and thus doesn't match the sname which
has a -. So instead a variable pypi_tar_name is used.

Note there is a hack for the generic_mysql_jar variable.  Rpmlint
falsely identifies this as needing to be replaced with %{_datadir},
when this is really a match string that needs to match the default
value in monasca-transform.conf.  Hack to get around this is to
concatenate two strings.

Future - need to try moving /etc/monasca-transform.conf

This cherry-pick includes: Updated monasca-transform to 0.11.0

(cherry picked from commit 9bd39e5e0be75383100e7b569cdff8e5f18be1ee)
(cherry picked from commit 3b60d511c3339a64b5fe8ec507797b52a8a5efd0)

Change-Id: Iaa2a5fc7526a19ad58f5199b5eb124caf18dcc45
"}]
commit_message:
Add monasca-transform

Include monasca-transform, the aggregation engine for Monasca.
Also requires Apache Spark to be installed separately.

Specifying a Requires: spark == 1.6.3 seems desirable, but there
is currently no package widely available in the community for
installing that version, so the Requires: is left out to allow an
administrator to manually install from the .tgz or find a suitable
package.
To function properly, Monasca Transform requires a number of Spark
libraries (in .jar format) on the local system.  This install will
not change the versions of these .jar files listed in
/etc/monasca-tranform.conf, so an administrator should reference
the .conf file for names and versions to update.
Note that among those .jar files needed is a JDBC driver for connecting
to a MySQL-compatible database instance.  Drizzle-jdbc 1.3 is expected
and configured in monasca-transform.conf.

Different from other deployments, this .spec inserts an
entry_point into the setup.cfg to allow pbr to create a script,
then installs a .service file that points to the resulting
/usr/bin/monasca-transform script.

Note that the name of the monasca_transform directory in the
.tgz includes an _ and thus doesn't match the sname which
has a -. So instead a variable pypi_tar_name is used.

Note there is a hack for the generic_mysql_jar variable.  Rpmlint
falsely identifies this as needing to be replaced with %{_datadir},
when this is really a match string that needs to match the default
value in monasca-transform.conf.  Hack to get around this is to
concatenate two strings.

Future - need to try moving /etc/monasca-transform.conf

This cherry-pick includes: Updated monasca-transform to 0.11.0

(cherry picked from commit 9bd39e5e0be75383100e7b569cdff8e5f18be1ee)
(cherry picked from commit 3b60d511c3339a64b5fe8ec507797b52a8a5efd0)

Change-Id: Iaa2a5fc7526a19ad58f5199b5eb124caf18dcc45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/70/540370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [Unit] Description=Monasca Transform Daemon After=zookeeper.service spark-master.service spark-worker.service [Service] Type=simple LimitNOFILE=32768 ExecStart=/usr/bin/monasca-transform [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target

subject: [WIP] Extend datasource to access log data from monasca-log-api.

[Putting this up now as it is done to get some early feedback,
 but obviously can't be used till the API is implemented]

Extend the datasource to be able to return what Grafana refers to as

endpoints, one datasource cannot access multiple endpoints, so two

logs. This change should not break existing installations, and will
assume it's previous behaviour (metrics) unless explicitly configured.

commit_message:
[WIP] Extend datasource to access log data from monasca-log-api.

[Putting this up now as it is done to get some early feedback,
 but obviously can't be used till the API is implemented]

Extend the datasource to be able to return what Grafana refers to as
'doc' objects (essentially JSON) from the monasca-log-api. This will
allow viewing of log entries in Table panels side-by-side with metrics
in Graph or other panels. Due to the way Grafana handles datasource
endpoints, one datasource cannot access multiple endpoints, so two
instances of the plugin must be created. One for metrics, and one for
logs. This change should not break existing installations, and will
assume it's previous behaviour (metrics) unless explicitly configured.

Change-Id: I20249c698d14066abd84fe024b1c1175b2bf234f

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I0593533e6b1c3dedd9a8c6180af2d2b30942f4ce

commit_message:
[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494
(cherry picked from commit 1b99d30fa2dd83524e87dfc71a8333acb91b2742)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/58/540358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def flush_log_file(self): try: self._log_file_handle.flush() except (AttributeError, ValueError): # We'll ignore errors caused by closed handles. pass

commit_message:
Fixes port security settings caching issue

When updating the MAC spoofing for a given vswitch port, its
Msvm_EthernetSwitchPortSecuritySettingData object is removed
and a new one is created, but the original object is not
cleared from the cache. Because of this, the next update will
fail with a Not Found exception.

This patch addresses this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1744755

Change-Id: I91b9000c64d269b7d5b1db9e0c6344bbd70e37b2
(cherry picked from commit 776270c4b3be0523f2ee2a73792b4a41bb52d6f5)

deleted_lines: if sec_settings: # Removing the feature because it cannot be modified # due to a wmi exception. self._jobutils.remove_virt_feature(sec_settings) self._jobutils.add_virt_feature(sec_settings, port_alloc)

commit_message:
Allow ability to configure number of processes and threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

This also adds the setting of threads and processes to the UWSGI
configuration.

Change-Id: I003ab426488966cce46bd6fd297c79ada13c9668
Closes-Bug: #1745631

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Set NIC model to 'virtio'

The role already uses the virtio driver to improve the disk peformance.
We can also use the virtio driver for the NIC device in order to improve
the network performance of the test VM. However, users may want to
change that so we are adding a new test_vm_nic Ansible variable for
that.

Change-Id: I9e5c9a33f1f6903d39d0fa2721288d084071e733

commit_message:
Fix get_server to work with use_direct_get

servers are different and are avoinding the underlying infrastructure.
Update the server methods to work right.

Change-Id: I1d783093084ad2bf05527980a61de95ec5a9ae31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/63/539663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.use_direct_get: searchfunc = functools.partial(self.get_server_by_id, bare=True) else: searchfunc = functools.partial(self.search_servers, detailed=detailed, bare=True, all_projects=all_projects) def get_server_by_id( self, id=None, detailed=False, bare=False, all_projects=False): """Get a server by ID. :param id: ID of the server. :param detailed: Whether or not to add detailed additional information. Defaults to False. :param bare: Whether to skip adding any additional information to the server record. Defaults to False, meaning the addresses dict will be populated as needed from neutron. Setting to True implies detailed = False. :param all_projects: Whether to get server from all projects or just the current auth scoped project. :returns: A server ``munch.Munch`` or None if no matching server is found. """ params = {} if all_projects: params['all_tenants'] = True data = self._compute_client.get( '/servers/{id}'.format(id=id), params=params) return self._expand_server( self._normalize_server(server), detailed=detailed, bare=bare)

commit_message:
tests: autospecs mock.patch and classes usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

Updates HyperVBaseTestCase to autospec the classes used by different
*Ops classes.

Change-Id: Ifbdc185d0b50e29c5d5f3ff036141253d2323076
Partial-Bug: #1735588

commit_message:
Add example of deploying with privileged virt

This example is copied from the following opnfv review

https://gerrit.opnfv.org/gerrit/#/c/28675/26/config/quickstart_defaults.yaml

It seems to work well for me, I can deploy VMs via quickstart which
show up via virt-manager and should survive reboots because
the qcow2 files are stored in /home/stack.

Change-Id: Ifbd0d6eefaebc3e8aec986501e67eadb5d7aa9cd
Closes-Bug: #1692987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/79/539879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If you prefer privileged VMs in order to use tools like virt-manager on the host # you can use these options. This also makes VMs survive reboots \o/ # This is particularly useful for local development environments non_root_chown: true non_root_user: stack undercloud_user: stack working_dir: "/home/{{non_root_user}}" ssh_user: root libvirt_uri: qemu:///system

commit_message:
Handle resources with no name

This commit prevents silent failures when encountering a resource with no name,
which has been observed with glance images that are in a "queued" state.

Change-Id: I65aec02c4e5ac66811006ec7f6ab0c17056ffdb7
Closes-Bug: #1746539

subject: Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-29 12:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/e0cc078db7b2eb763cef5da02bc317a78a74d887', 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I2ef84692b57e136fc6008f33f3e48f861f9a58da
Link: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
"}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy.

Change-Id: I2ef84692b57e136fc6008f33f3e48f861f9a58da
Link: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/03/538903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add SELinux python support to ansible-runtime venv

This patch adds python bindings for SELinux to the ansible-runtime
venv. It allows ansible to download files and perform other tasks
that require SELinux support (such as downloading the cirros image
during the tempest role run).

A symlink is insufficient based on how the SELinux python module is
structured.

Closes-Bug: 1746283
Change-Id: Ieddf37860f8b84d965d0206e49a0b38f6fc3d2ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/52/539552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add SELinux support to the venv if [ -d "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux/" ]; then rsync -avX /usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux/ /opt/ansible-runtime/lib64/python2.7/selinux/ fi

commit_message:
Set Horizon default member role to 'Member'

As of Ib85479442ec68f9a67615c23e5c39bd217c9b109 Keystone no longer
creates the _member_ role, which Horizon relies on to assign users to
projects. The Member role should still get created as part of a TripleO
deployment, switch Horizon to using that instead.

Change-Id: Ieebc27a742ebe9f7f68be1f489b142eac13e5b14
Closes-Bug: #1741066

commit_message:
Remove build-javascript-tarball job from nodejs-jobs

The sole purpose of the build-javascript-tarball job is to check that
"npm pack" succeeds.  In an npm project, "npm pack" depends on "npm
install".  Once the project is successfully installed, "npm pack" always
succeeds because it's just a thin wrapper around "tar".
build-javascript-tarball has nodejs-npm as its parent which handles
installing of npm dependencies.

Therefore, build-javascript-tarball is redundant.

Change-Id: Id57e4c41f23544891f2a16cba3f4b5c59b4610c1

the networking-l2gw repo. Turns out there are several repos

commit_message:
Fix vmware-nsx stable-periodic docs job

The vmware-nsx job has been failing with an error looking for
the networking-l2gw repo. Turns out there are several repos
needed by this job, but the stable-periodic pipeline did not
define the required-projects that were used elsewhere.

This adds the required-projects used in the check and check
and gate queues to the job in the periodic-stable pipeline.

Change-Id: I29a7dd501ec9878b7b9bd14f1bd2db957e78e142

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Ceilometer]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 776338d54c030c3a9a02fc0e76ad27f35342fba2)
Change-Id: I28488b51e6a2e2d0e0ac41d0d7c35be4edb59cbb
Partial-Bug: #1704389
Closes-Bug: #1724478

commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/83/539583/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Remove existing directory if it is not a git repo or it is dirty shell: | EXIT_CODE=0 FOLDER_PATH="/usr/share/novnc" if [[ -e ${FOLDER_PATH} ]]; then if [[ ! -d "${FOLDER_PATH}/.git" ]]; then echo "${FOLDER_PATH} is not a git repo, deleting..." EXIT_CODE=2 elif test -n "$(cd ${FOLDER_PATH}; git status --porcelain)"; then echo "${FOLDER_PATH} is a dirty git repo, deleting..." EXIT_CODE=2 fi if [[ "${EXIT_CODE}" == "2" ]]; then rm -rf ${FOLDER_PATH} fi fi exit ${EXIT_CODE} args: executable: /bin/bash register: existing_dir_cleanup changed_when: existing_dir_cleanup.rc == 2 failed_when: existing_dir_cleanup.rc not in [0,2] notify: - Manage LB - Restart nova services notify: - Manage LB - Restart nova services
deleted_lines: - name: Remove old git directory file: path: "/usr/share/novnc" state: "absent"

subject: Qinling: Function as a Service in OpenStack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-16 00:04:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/d1c98ec80bb1e611b57ba62871cf0b97956a8b22', 'message': 'Qinling: Function as a Service in OpenStack

Qinling aims to provide "Function as a service" in OpenStack. Qinling provide a
platform to support serverless functions (like AWS Lambda) by leveraging the
container orchestration platforms (Kubernetes/Swarm, etc.) and different
function package storage backends (local/Swift/S3) using plugable mechanism.

Project History:
As an OpenStack based public cloud provider in New Zealand,
Catalyst Cloud[1] helps most of local enterprise customers to innovate by using
and contributing lots of OpenStack projects. From the feedback and requirements
of our customers, FaaS is one of the most wanted services. After evaluating the
existing open source projects, we decided to create a new project in OpenStack
and started development from the April of 2017. We also did several successful
POCs during 2017 after the first alpha release. In Sydney Summit, the project
was first introduced to the whole community[2].

Because most of the engineers from Catalyst Cloud development team are active
and experienced contributors in OpenStack upstream, the project developement
process aligns with the OpenStack upstream convention from day 1. What's more,
as an OpenStack project, we are trying to integrate with other OpenStack
services as possible as we could, e.g. Qinling uses keystonemiddleware for
authentication; supports functions to be stored in Swift; in the function code,
the developers can easily interact with other services without explicitly
providing and storing their own OpenStack credentials; Qinling supports webhook
URL for functions that can be used direclty in Aodh or Zaqar, etc. Most
importantly, Qinling doesn't rely on any commercial product for its
implementation.

Satisfaction of new projects requirements:

* Open Source: All Qinling source codes, specifications, and
  documentations are use Apache License 2.0. All the library dependencies
  come from the global requirements file of openstack/requirements repo.

* Open Community: I myself am current PTL of the project and will continue
  working on it almost full time. Although we don't have weekly irc meeting
  yet, #openstack-qinling IRC channel is always open for anyone to interact
  with Qinling team. I keep sending the project update email by-weekly in
  openstack-dev mailing list[3][4]. After the Qinling presentation in Sydney
  Summit, there are more and more developers showing interests to the project
  by contribution[5].

* Open Development: Qinling uses Gerrit for code reviews and Launchpad
  for bugs and blueprints tracking[6]. The project is integrated with the
  Openstack CI, and runs pep8, py27 and functional jobs. Qinling is implemented
  using libraries and technologies adopted by other existing OpenStack projects.

* Open Design: Currently, all the features and bugs can be found in Launchpad,
  any feature requests are welcomed. As I mentioned, we also use openstack-dev
  mailing list for discussion about anything related to the project.

The Qinling team is happy to participate in any goals specified by TC, and meet
any other policies that the TC requires.

[1]: https://www.catalyst.net.nz/catalyst-cloud
[2]: https://youtu.be/NmCmOfRBlIU
[3]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125413.html
[4]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126018.html
[5]: http://stackalytics.com/?project_type=openstack-others&metric=commits&release=all&module=qinling

commit_message:
Qinling: Function as a Service in OpenStack

Qinling aims to provide "Function as a service" in OpenStack. Qinling provides
a platform to support serverless functions (like AWS Lambda) by leveraging the
container orchestration platforms (Kubernetes/Swarm, etc.) and different
function package storage backends (local/Swift/S3) using plugable mechanism.

Project History:
As an OpenStack based public cloud provider in New Zealand,
Catalyst Cloud[1] helps most of local enterprise customers to innovate by using
and contributing lots of OpenStack projects. From the feedback and requirements
of our customers, FaaS is one of the most wanted services. After evaluating the
existing open source projects, we decided to create a new project in OpenStack
and started development from the April of 2017. We also did several successful
POCs during 2017 after the first alpha release. In Sydney Summit, the project
was first introduced to the whole community[2].

As most of the engineers from Catalyst Cloud development team are active
and experienced contributors in OpenStack upstream, the project developement
process aligns with the OpenStack upstream convention from day 1. What's more,
as an OpenStack project, we are trying to integrate with other OpenStack
services as possible as we could, e.g. Qinling uses keystonemiddleware for
authentication; supports functions to be stored in Swift; in the function code,
the developers can easily interact with other services without explicitly
providing and storing their own OpenStack credentials; Qinling supports webhook
URL for functions that can be used direclty in Aodh or Zaqar, etc. Most
importantly, Qinling doesn't rely on any commercial product for its
implementation.

Satisfaction of new projects requirements:

* Open Source: All Qinling source codes, specifications, and
  documentations are use Apache License 2.0. All the library dependencies
  come from the global requirements file of openstack/requirements repo.

* Open Community: I myself am current PTL of the project and will continue
  working on it almost full time. Although we don't have weekly irc meeting
  yet, #openstack-qinling IRC channel is always open for anyone to interact
  with Qinling team. I keep sending the project update email by-weekly in
  openstack-dev mailing list[3][4]. After the Qinling presentation in Sydney
  Summit, there are more and more developers showing interests to the project
  by contribution[5].

* Open Development: Qinling uses Gerrit for code reviews and Launchpad
  for bugs and blueprints tracking[6]. The project is integrated with the
  Openstack CI, and runs pep8, py27 and functional jobs. Qinling is implemented
  using libraries and technologies adopted by other existing OpenStack projects.

* Open Design: Currently, all the features and bugs can be found in Launchpad,
  any feature requests are welcomed. As I mentioned, we also use openstack-dev
  mailing list for discussion about anything related to the project.

The Qinling team is happy to participate in any goals specified by TC, and meet
any other policies that the TC requires.

[1]: https://www.catalyst.net.nz/catalyst-cloud
[2]: https://youtu.be/NmCmOfRBlIU
[3]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125413.html
[4]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126018.html
[5]: http://stackalytics.com/?project_type=openstack-others&metric=commits&release=all&module=qinling

commit_message:
doc: placement upgrade notes for queens

This adds a mention of the nova-scheduler service requiring
placement 1.17 and also links to the placement upgrade notes
from the more general upgrade notes, since we are now firmly
in a place where placement needs to be upgraded before nova.

Since we consider placement global, this removes the 1.14
note about nova-compute since we assume that if you're going
to upgrade placement to get 1.17 for the scheduler, and control
services should be upgraded before computes, then the computes
are going to get a new enough placement service automatically.

Change-Id: I06937c7642dca4a1932cbbf46569acc9c58e44a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/539658/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Several nova services rely on the external placement service, and while efforts are made for the nova code to work with older versions of the placement API, it is generally best to upgrade placement before any nova services. See the :ref:`placement upgrade notes <placement-upgrade-notes>` for more details on upgrading the placement service.

commit_message:
Stop _undefine_domain erroring if domain not found

During live-migration stress testing we are seeing the following log:
Error from libvirt during undefine. Code=42 Error=Domain not found

There appears to be a race while trying to undefine the domain, and
something else is possibly also doing some kind of clean up. While this
does paper over that race, it stops otherwise completed live-migrations
from failing. It also matches similar error handling done for when
deleting the domain.

The next part of the bug fix is to ensure if we have any similar
unexpected errors during this later phase of the live-migration we don't
leave the instance stuck in the migrating state, it should move to an
ERROR state. This is covered in a follow on patch.

Partial-Bug: #1662626

Change-Id: I23ed9819061bfa436b12180110666c5b8c3e0f70
(cherry picked from commit b706155888d740841d745c52aae543cf82fab0bc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/508640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, "_has_uefi_support") @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "get_guest") def test_undefine_domain_handles_libvirt_errors(self, mock_get, mock_has_uefi): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) instance = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) fake_guest = mock.Mock() mock_get.return_value = fake_guest unexpected = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, "Random", error_code=1) fake_guest.delete_configuration.side_effect = unexpected # ensure raise unexpected error code self.assertRaises(type(unexpected), drvr._undefine_domain, instance) ignored = fakelibvirt.make_libvirtError( fakelibvirt.libvirtError, "No such domain", error_code=fakelibvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_DOMAIN) fake_guest.delete_configuration.side_effect = ignored # ensure no raise for no such domain drvr._undefine_domain(instance)

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use . to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: If2ef1f3f56008f7e9e1bec13b94d542a3b9667e7

subject: add string template rendering capability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-28 23:01:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack/commit/a47d41018f0af30ff0835db2a9f0128bec59e06d', 'message': 'add string template rendering capability

In some cases software deliberately allows drop-in config file usage
capabilities, for example, when it comes to enforcing policy, the
desired behavior varies from an operator to operator. For that reason it
is sometimes desirable to supply custom templates via config options.

Another use-case is templates that are passed from subordinates for a
primary charm to render.

Given that properties and desired adapters can be arbitrary the change
uses a dict of meta tuples of the following format to render templates
from strings based on adapter properties:

{config_file_path: (relation_name, adapter property)}

relation names must be normalized (lowercase, underscores instead of
dashes. "options" relation name is used for a config adapter as usual.

In summary a string config file path should be used:

1. in the restart_map for a given derived class;
2. in string_templates dict as a key for a meta tuple

Change-Id: Ic85b22d0e5d497c49c75243e3c280140f940df66
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-28 23:16:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack/commit/a5152bbee506514f3e19924515e17dc8b06bdcfb', 'message': 'add string template rendering capability

In some cases software deliberately allows drop-in config file usage
capabilities, for example, when it comes to enforcing policy, the
desired behavior varies from an operator to operator. For that reason it
is sometimes desirable to supply custom templates via config options.

Another use-case is templates that are passed from subordinates for a
primary charm to render.

Given that properties and desired adapters can be arbitrary the change
uses a dict of meta tuples of the following format to render templates
from strings based on adapter properties:

{config_file_path: (relation_name, adapter property)}

relation names must be normalized (lowercase, underscores instead of
dashes. "options" relation name is used for a config adapter as usual.

In summary a string config file path should be used:

commit_message:
add string template rendering capability

In some cases software deliberately allows drop-in config file usage
capabilities, for example, when it comes to enforcing policy, the
desired behavior varies from an operator to operator. For that reason it
is sometimes desirable to supply custom templates via config options.

Another use-case is templates that are passed from subordinates for a
primary charm to render.

Given that properties and desired adapters can be arbitrary the change
uses a dict of meta tuples of the following format to render templates
from strings based on adapter properties:

{config_file_path: (relation_name, adapter property)}

relation names must be normalized (lowercase, underscores instead of
dashes. "options" relation name is used for a config adapter as usual.

In summary a string config file path should be used:

1. in the restart_map for a given derived class;
2. in string_templates dict as a key for a meta tuple

Change-Id: Ic85b22d0e5d497c49c75243e3c280140f940df66
Closes-Bug: #1741723

commit_message:
Remove project name from Zuul

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Wait for ironic-neutron-agent to report state

Wait for the agent to finish reporting state, bridge_mappings
must be reported prior to any cleaning attempts.

Change-Id: I041761dd896c9d89dc6cf7bafc991a0697ded05b
Related-Bug: #1658964

commit_message:
Remove unwanted test packages from puppet-tempest

* python-{swift,nova,glance}-tests contains only unit tests.
  It does not make any sense to install it. As it does not have
  tempest tests. Their tempest tests resides with in tempest
  package itself.

Change-Id: I17afca9a98b0920c6b6ecb0e82a7d80198d1f810

commit_message:
Move zuulv3 jobs to project repo

This patch moves the zuulv3 jobs for ec2-api repo.

This is first step to switch jobs to ec2 tempest plugin.

There is already gate broken due to switching neutron_vpnaas
to neutron-tempest-plugin whichy stop any further updates to merge
in ec2-api repo.
This commit also fix that.

To make this merge, legacy job needs to be remopved first. Done in below
dependent patch:
Depends-On: I0e5a1c37b407497fd9e60e58bac7c7a89e14dc75

Needed-By: I0c342072f7d749b0243889e2bedd636347df23ef

Change-Id: I9c88ac1ecf0368c9ea7a8b20c84995ea29487184

commit_message:
Use single quotes instead of backquotes for i18n string

Using the backquotes causes the new lines to appear as is in the pot
files, making the pot file invalid and causing the upload to Zanata to
fail with the "missing end-quote" error.

Change-Id: I820cac7ad401bd0e0c0e31f088c4efede3263ff2
Closes-Bug: #1737577
(cherry picked from commit c18a9b9819b77e3f9bdccc3ec2fef6a103d75cf1)

revisions:

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-11 18:08:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c735a15d3ce942975fcd55aa3229d7b6614f00ad', 'message': 'WIP: Pass limit to /allocation_requests

Change-Id: I1c34964a74123b3d94ccae89d7cac0426b57b9b6
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-30 17:00:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/38fdfbc38b8d0440ec36efe9795f38f721d18c07', 'message': "Pass limit to /allocation_requests

This makes us pass an upper limit to placement when doing scheduling

commit_message:
Pass limit to /allocation_requests

This makes us pass an upper limit to placement when doing scheduling
activities. Without this, we'll always receive every host in the
deployment (that has space for the request), which may be very large.

Closes-Bug: #1746294
Change-Id: I1c34964a74123b3d94ccae89d7cac0426b57b9b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/531517/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt("max_placement_results", default=1000, help=""" This setting determines the maximum limit on results received from the placement service during a scheduling operation. It effectively limits the number of hosts that may be considered for scheduling requestrs that match a large number of candidates. This option is only used by the FilterScheduler and its subclasses; if you use a different scheduler, this option has no effect. """),

subject: handle no default_cgsnapshot_type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-17 17:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/group_types.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/29456fa515d18343ae7f98a50455eb2fd84fce47', 'message': 'handle no default_cgsnapshot_type

If default_cgsnapshot_type has been deleted, group operations for
drivers relying on the generic volume group implementation were failing
with a KeyError while attempting to determine if the targeted group was
default_cgsnapshot_type. This fixes that by using a comparison that
allows for the possibility that default_cgsnapshot_type does not
exist.

Change-Id: Ic220ea4d8a6e83293e5237acfb07b1a417293803
Closes-Bug: #1710937
(cherry picked from commit be7b476d562f79d649724555aeadfad60127e356)
'}]
commit_message:
handle no default_cgsnapshot_type

If default_cgsnapshot_type has been deleted, group operations for
drivers relying on the generic volume group implementation were failing
with a KeyError while attempting to determine if the targeted group was
default_cgsnapshot_type. This fixes that by using a comparison that
allows for the possibility that default_cgsnapshot_type does not
exist.

Change-Id: Ic220ea4d8a6e83293e5237acfb07b1a417293803
Closes-Bug: #1710937
(cherry picked from commit be7b476d562f79d649724555aeadfad60127e356)

commit_message:
Add resize test for multiattach volumes

This adds a test to create a multiattach volume and attach
it to two servers, then resizes those servers and detaches
the volume from each server.

Depends-On: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18

Change-Id: Icd7dbcfe9b62df5311053e2da073c7a5546da319
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/73/532973/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('f01c7169-a124-4fc7-ae60-5e380e247c9c') def test_resize_server_with_multiattached_volume(self): # Attach a single volume to multiple servers, then resize the servers servers, volume, _ = self._create_and_multiattach() for server in servers: self.resize_server(server['id'], self.flavor_ref_alt) for server in servers: self._detach_multiattach_volume(volume['id'], server['id'])
deleted_lines: # TODO(mriedem): Test migration with a multiattached volume.

commit_message:
add "--until-complete" option for nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows.

Change-Id: Idaa6ed0821c36092bd595619dfd1b9fd25332f21
Closes-bug: #1746531
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/539878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows [--max_rows <number>] [--verbose] [--until-complete]`` that were changed. Specifying --until-complete will make the command run continuously until all deleted rows are archived. Use the --max_rows option, which defaults to 1000, as a batch size for each iteration.

commit_message:
Only log not correcting allocation once per period

Logging once per instance per periodic task run that nothing was done,
because it is already correct, is unnecessary.

Fix the wording of the debug messages, to be correct after future
releases and account for the ironic driver requesting the same
behaviour.

Closes-Bug: 1719714
Change-Id: Id68b68c261efbe4f18d2fb15cb08240866e22466
(cherry picked from commit 895e3be3fee74bf71a80e9ccad482fdd408fa42f)

") elif has_ocata_computes: msg_allocation_refresh = ( "We're on a compute host from Nova version >=16 (Pike or " "later) in a deployment with at least one compute host " "version <16 (Ocata or earlier). ") msg_allocation_refresh += ( "Will auto-correct allocations to handle " "Ocata-style assumptions.") if msg_allocation_refresh: LOG.debug(msg_allocation_refresh) msg_allocation_refresh = False

The scheduler will # allocate the resources for the destination host to the # instance UUID. LOG.debug("We're on a Pike compute host in a deployment " "with all Pike compute hosts. Skipping " "auto-correction of allocations.")

commit_message:
Refactor expirer unit tests

In expirer's unit tests, fake InternalClient classes are defined
and its instance simulates expirer's task queue behaviors.

To make review for expirer's task queue update patch [1] easy,
this patch refactors the implementation of the fake InternalClient
classes. In this patch, unit tests are refactored by the following
two approaches:
    #1: Summarizing duplicated fake InternalClient implementation
    #2: Make task account name variable
The #2 approach is for multiple task accounts in [1].

The patch [1] will be rebased after this patch merged.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: I10a7151cfdd43460ad38c47f672d3c31b77e7990

subject: Fix instance lookup in hide_server_addresses extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-10 23:42:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/hide_server_addresses.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/31b2f0a2a65b782be4d0a68b3b53604a076f4748', 'message': "Fix instance lookup in hide_server_addresses extension

The hide_server_addresses extension is looking up the cached
instance based on what the user provided for the server id,
which may not match what is used to cache the instance for the
request. For example, a request with upper-case server uuid
could be found in a mysql-backed system because mysql is
case insensitive by default, but the instance is keyed off the
server id from the DB, which is lower-case, so we'll fail
to look up the instance in the cache if the IDs don't match.

There is no test for this because it turns out it's actually
really hard to recreate this since it requires running with a
mysql backend to recreate the case insensitive check, which
isn't going to work with sqlite. Given how trivial this fix is,
creating a big mysql recreate test is not worth it.

Change-Id: I09b288aa2ad9969800a3cd26c675b002c6c9f638
Closes-Bug: #1693335
(cherry picked from commit ecfb65cee68e96cc99ceecddbf27c6d6f768358e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance lookup in hide_server_addresses extension

The hide_server_addresses extension is looking up the cached
instance based on what the user provided for the server id,
which may not match what is used to cache the instance for the
request. For example, a request with upper-case server uuid
could be found in a mysql-backed system because mysql is
case insensitive by default, but the instance is keyed off the
server id from the DB, which is lower-case, so we'll fail
to look up the instance in the cache if the IDs don't match.

There is no test for this because it turns out it's actually
really hard to recreate this since it requires running with a
mysql backend to recreate the case insensitive check, which
isn't going to work with sqlite. Given how trivial this fix is,
creating a big mysql recreate test is not worth it.

Change-Id: I09b288aa2ad9969800a3cd26c675b002c6c9f638
Closes-Bug: #1693335
(cherry picked from commit ecfb65cee68e96cc99ceecddbf27c6d6f768358e)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I897b82a12198ab951ebad99e3bdf59314ec4e936

Fix wrong value type of PoolTargetOption

Follow pools.yaml sample file [1] we can see some values
is not string, it can be integer or something else.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/etc/designate/pools.yaml.sample-bind

Change-Id: I3eac482f4230cb89d4937f23b0a9819154e04bd3

commit_message:
Limit the amount of disk of container

The patch supports the storage_opt size=xxx when run/create
a container. If user set this option, it can limit the size
of the hard disk per container.

Change-Id: Iafcf9d1a4a2b7ccb70998d8797eada29ed3315f5
Implements: blueprint limit-container-diskspace

We currently log that we timed out waiting for vif plugging callbacks

commit_message:
Log the events we timed out waiting for while plugging vifs

We currently log that we timed out waiting for vif plugging callbacks
from neutron but we don't include detail about which vif_ids we were
waiting for. This adds the event_names to the log message to aid
in debugging.

Related-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: I8b67f1049b6a968b1dd0d839a7f0b30aa1730eeb

These were causing a lot of warnings during test runs because they are
deprecated and should be removed.

commit_message:
Run cinder-backup in a privileged container

The cinder-backup service requires privileges in order to make iSCSI
connections.

Closes-Bug: 1745628
Change-Id: I63423ac4715269163e36d59d2703502455d33f86
(cherry picked from commit 0c65801ac9ea8b12d670a05ace85a96cb8828b22)

subject: Fix cinder quota-usage error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 05:32:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9c763e04be02003f353e54f4f2eb0af39bf92961', 'message': "Fix cinder quota-usage error

When backing up a snapshot or 'in-use' volume,
cinder creates a temp volume from the snapshot
or 'in-use' volume, then backup the temp volume.
The temp volume doesn't use the volume-quota,
but deleting the temp volume when finishing
backup will minus quota. This process leads to
a wrong quota-usage. So when deleting a temp
volume, skip handling quota.

Change-Id: If100a678cf9062c4078f850d8edc001b6b0705f4
Closes-Bug: #1670636
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-18 23:39:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7c380a1e623f14da4d093e5847adbd501252062b', 'message': "Fix cinder quota-usage error

When backing up a snapshot or 'in-use' volume,
cinder creates a temp volume from the snapshot

The temp volume doesn't use the volume-quota,
but deleting the temp volume when finishing
backup will minus quota. This process leads to
a wrong quota-usage. So when deleting a temp
volume, skip handling quota.

commit_message:
Fix cinder quota-usage error

When backing up a snapshot or 'in-use' volume,
cinder creates a temp volume from the snapshot
or 'in-use' volume, then backup the temp volume.
The temp volume doesn't use the volume-quota,
but deleting the temp volume when finishing
backup will minus quota. This process leads to
a wrong quota-usage. So add admin volume metadata
when creating the temporary volume and then use
that data to detect temporary volume. Then skip
handling quota when deleting the temp volume.

Change-Id: If100a678cf9062c4078f850d8edc001b6b0705f4
Closes-Bug: #1670636

added_lines: 3. Delete a temp volume for backup If deleting the temp volume for backup, we want to skip quotas but we need database updates for the volume. # To backup a snapshot or a 'in-use' volume, create a temp volume # from the snapshot or in-use volume, and back it up. # Temp volume has a fixed name format: backup-vol-{volume_id} is_temp_vol = True if 'backup-vol' in volume.display_name else False if is_temp_vol: LOG.info("Try to delete temp volume: %s", volume.id) # If deleting source/destination volume in a migration or a temp # volume for backup, we should skip quotas. skip_quota = True if is_migrating or is_temp_vol else False if not skip_quota: # If deleting source/destination volume in a migration or a temp # volume for backup, we should skip quotas. if not skip_quota:
deleted_lines: # If deleting source/destination volume in a migration, we should # skip quotas. if not is_migrating: # If deleting source/destination volume in a migration, we should # skip quotas. if not is_migrating:
